magpie.utility.tools

Class IonicCompoundFinder

  • java.lang.Object
    • magpie.utility.tools.IonicCompoundFinder
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Commandable

    public class IonicCompoundFinder
extends java.lang.Object
implements Commandable
    Given a nominal composition, find nearby compositions that can be charge neutral.

    Works by finding all combinations of elements in the supplied composition that are within a certain distance of the target composition with less than a certain number of atoms per unit cell.

    Distance is computed as the L1 distance of the composition vector. Example: Fe3Al and FeAl are 0.5 apart.

    Implemented Command

    run <composition> <distance> <size> - Find all neutral compounds within a certain distance of a target
    composition: Target composition
    distance: Maximum allowed distance
    size: Maximum number of atoms in formula unit.

      • setMaximumDistance

        public void setMaximumDistance(double dist)
        Set the maximum allowed distance from the target value. Note, distance is computed as the L1 norm of the composition vector assuming one of the elements is a balance (i.e., only sum the difference for N-1 elements).
        Parameters:
        dist - Maximum allowed distance

      • setMaxFormulaUnitSize

        public void setMaxFormulaUnitSize(int size)
        Set maximum number of atoms in formula unit. Example: NaCl has 2
        Parameters:
        size - Maximum allowed size

      • findAllCompounds

        public java.util.List<CompositionEntry> findAllCompounds()
                                                  throws java.lang.Exception
        Locate all ionic compounds within a certain distance of the target composition. Subject to the constraints set by setMaximumDistance(double) and setMaxFormulaUnitSize(int).
        Returns:
        List of possible compositions
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception
